topic.title: Authentication
topic.shortdesc: Authentication is a process that securely identifies who is accessing the system.

body.p: Only Couchbase administrators and applications can authenticate with Couchbase Server:

dlentry.dd:
Full and read-only Couchbase administrators authenticate with Couchbase Server using their credentials (username and password).
See .
When the full Couchbase administrator enables LDAP, he can also configure additional full and read-only LDAP administrators.
See .

Applications authenticate with Couchbase Server using the bucket name and the SASL password.
See .
